message.body: Hey, we need a licensed contractor to give an estimate for loan purposes in the near future and then do some work in late Jan/early Feb. Would you be do
wn for that?
I'm not really doing construction any more. I could see if Michael will do it.
Yeah, that could be good. We're looking at trying to stick to a pretty tight timeline; is he pretty prompt with stuff? Also, I don't have his contact info.
It depends on how busy he is but winter is usually less busy. I'll contact him first
What kind of work?
He said he could do thursday or Friday or possibly this weekend
Sounds good. We have a master bedroom that still has plaster and , whereas
Sorry, didn't mean to send that. More proper text coming.
We have a master bedroom that still has plaster and several coats of wallpaper that's falling off, whereas the rest of the house has been redone with dr
ywall. So we'd like to update the bedroom to match the rest of the house.
Ok, I'm not sure if he's going to want to do that job or not, but he can give you a licensed estimate anyway
Gotcha. We'd prob want the person doing the job to do the estimate just for continuity. If he's not interested, do you know someone who might be more in
to something like that? If not we can look up some people our realtor might know about.@
Gonna be hard to find someone who's licensed to do a tiny demo and drywall job. He might do it. Just ask
I would say Adam cooper but he's not licensed and has a full time job now.
Or Michael may know of a drywall contractor that's licensed or be able to get subs
Yeah, needs to be licensed cuz i
U can check Angie's list too. Check with Michael. I shouldn't speak for him whether he wants to do it or not. I just know that I wouldn't want to do it.
Sounds good. Can I get his contact info or could you give him mine?
I already sent it.
Sent my info to him, or sent me his info via email?
Sorry I didn't realize that you can't forward contacts to non iPhones
Yes, my phone is special. Still haven't gotten on the smartphone wave. Thx!
